result.execSummary:
The defendant Shushika R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) dismiss H/O enhancer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) Dismiss the H/O and PTAC enhancer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia dismiss H/O enhancer, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and stayed.  AMENDED 09-04-2015:  Huber for work, school and treatment.
Concurrent with: 14CM1838.

CORRECTED 06-24-2015:  JOC corrected to reflect conviction and sentence on Cts. 2 and 3 only (clerical error when preparing JOC included Ct. 1 as being sentenced but that count was held open)
Concurrent with: 14CM1838.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.  Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must participate in and successfully complete the Drug Treatment Program.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Appeal rights given.
The defendant is to report to her probation officer after court on February 4, 2015.

charges.descr: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500)  Dismiss the H/O and PTAC  enhancer

Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with victim store except for restitution purposes.  No contact with the co-defendant.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
